answers.question: What is the waiting period for pre-existing diseases (PED) to be covered?
answers.answer:
Based on the provided excerpt, the waiting period for pre-existing diseases (PED) is as follows:

Expenses related to the treatment of a Pre-Existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications are excluded until the expiry of thirty-six (36) months of continuous coverage from the date of inception of the first policy.

This waiting period can be reduced if the Insured Person has been continuously covered under a previous policy, as per the portability norms of the extant IRDAI (Health Insurance) Regulations. The reduction would be to the extent of the prior coverage period.

Furthermore, coverage for any pre-existing disease after the thirty-six-month waiting period is contingent upon the disease having been declared at the time of application and accepted by the company.
